According to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-404, MapR maven repository shouldn't be activated by default. Could you move MapR repository into profile, like https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/pull/404 did for cloudera repo?

3rd party dependency licenses are handled 

/LICENSE - for source package
/NOTICE  - for source package
/licenses - copies of 3rd party dependency license

/zeppelin-distribution/src/bin_license/LICENSE - for binary package
/zeppelin-distribution/src/bin_license/NOTICE - for binary package
/zeppelin-distribution/src/bin_license/licenses - copies of 3rd party dependency license for binary package

/zeppelin-distribution/src/bin_license is merged into /LICENSE, /NOTICE, /licenses by /dev/create_release.sh when creating release package.

Please review it.
Okay, Merging it if there're no more discussions.

I noticed that it works great when there is no horizontal scrolling. However, when there is output of paragraphs which extends beyond horizontal screen, it scrolls the window horizontally as well.

If I understand correctly this requires a special build of Flink?

Here's little bit of history.

Currently, Zeppelin has 3 Looknfeels. 'default', 'simple' and 'report'. But before the looknfeel feature, there were only single style, and that was 'simple'. 'default' was introduced as a alternative to 'simple', based on feedbacks
- Hard to distinguish Paragraphs -> gray background
- Hard to find buttons -> controls always shown

Therefore 'default' was intended to show controls always, while 'simple' show only on hover mouse.

It could be challenging, but what do you think make it aware contents length of 1st line and hide (or make it almost transparent) control only when there're text underneath, and show as a normal on mouse hover? Do you think it's a good idea?

looks good, this covers most of this earlier bug: ZEPPELIN-368
I'd say we would need to add: complete list of properties supported by interpreters (eg. there're a few for %dep), using z to pass DataFrame, add more on starting Zeppelin when SPARK_HOME is set (provided Spark) (or rather, how to config Spark if SPARK_HOME is not set?)
Thanks, Could you also handle repository section in hive/pom.xml?

I see, so this is referring to 0.10 Flink only?
"
http://trevorgrant.org/2015/11/03/apache-casserole-a-delicious-big-data-recipe-for-the-whole-family/
It runs against Flink 0.10 (Till Rohrmann's branch) and Spark 1.4. It would
probably help if Till's support for Flink 0.10 was merged back in, then I
could probably also get it working against Spark 1.5 (or 1.6).  As it was,
those two (Spark 1.5 and 1.6) were what really killed me the last few days,
I finally gave up and just used 1.4 which worked well."

After thinking about it more, _Enable paragraph_ and _Disable paragraph_ can be a bit confusing since the paragraph is still shown.

_Enable run_ and _Disable run_ would be more meaningfull. And for the Icon, we should have the same as the run button, not an icon that change.
Any easy way to reproduce this, for me to test this PR?

Create output larger than paragraph width, eg ``` println("""%html
output
""") ``` and create other paragraphs a head of it, long enough to trigger scroll. And then you'll see horizontal scroll when you trigger scroll to this paragraph.
+1 for Enable/Disable run than Enable/Disable paragraph.

> what do you think make it aware contents length of 1st line and hide (or make it almost transparent) control only when there're text underneath, and show as a normal on mouse hover? 

Will make the paragraph ui inconsistent.  how about an auto show/hide option which can be turned on or off. we can call it "Auto hide controls" and it should be available only in default view
Sure! Please feel free.

Not a big fan of adding too many switch options, there is already many.

One possible way, would be to show those controls outside of the text editor when there is a title shown.
That way, in some case it wouldn't obstruct the editor.

I tried before to play with the opacity of that action buttons component background, but this is pretty much as far as we can go.

Thanks @Leemoonsoo, seems to fix the issue.

@sjeandeaux 
- I suggest to expose `conf`, `logs` and `notebook` as volumes.
- Recently the recommended way to start Zeppelin is to provide `SPARK_HOME` (and optionally `HADOOP_HOME`) so there's no need to manage an official build for every Spark/Hadoop combination.
- Running Zeppelin through user `zeppelin` would be considered as more secure. However, it used to make the use of RW volumes painful. We should check if it is still the case as of version 1.9 of Docker Engine. Work has moved forward in this field but I don't know if the user namespace feature is actually complete.

Ahh, yes the blog version runs against a branch of Zeppelin that covers the most up to date Flink.  That seemed inappropriate here so these directions refer to Flink 0.9.

In the future, maybe we can think automatically adds default interpreter name into editor. 
To do that we'll need to decide, when %[name] is going to be inserted (when cursor hit the control? or when paragraph is created), and what will be inserted (default interpreter? or the same interpreter used in the previous paragraph). I think this could be handled in another issue.
